column4: make and make install seem to have created the no-ip executable
no-ip ?
its a dns server of sorts
allows you to get your IP without a domain name.
for something - yes, eg: xorg is a new version, with compiz along side it, other stuff, eg: apache - no2
primary concern, is vmware and OpenVPN
I wouldn't have confidence with vmware with it being a 3rd party product
Vmware works like a charm, but it did have to go through hell to make it work
so I wouldn't put money on stability on 7.04 -> 7.10 update
personal preference is always instrall from scratch if you can afford the time
depends what you want to look for
